segment.source: Test Surface Hub apps using Visual Studio
segment.target: Test Surface Hub apps using Visual Studio

segment.source: The Visual Studio simulator provides an environment to design, develop, debug, and test UWP apps, including apps built for Surface Hub.
segment.target: The Visual Studio simulator provides an environment to design, develop, debug, and test UWP apps, including apps built for Surface Hub.

segment.source: Test Surface Hub apps using Visual Studio
segment.target: Test Surface Hub apps using Visual Studio

segment.source: The Visual Studio simulator provides an environment where you can design, develop, debug, and test Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, including apps that you have built for Microsoft Surface Hub.
segment.target: The Visual Studio simulator provides an environment where you can design, develop, debug, and test Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps, including apps that you have built for Microsoft Surface Hub.

segment.source: The simulator does not use the same user interface as Surface Hub, but it is useful for testing how your app looks and behaves at the Surface Hub's screen size and resolution.
segment.target: The simulator does not use the same user interface as Surface Hub, but it is useful for testing how your app looks and behaves at the Surface Hub's screen size and resolution.

segment.source: For more information, see Run Windows Store apps in the simulator.
segment.target: For more information, see Run Windows Store apps in the simulator.

segment.source: Add Surface Hub resolutions to the simulator
segment.target: Add Surface Hub resolutions to the simulator

segment.source: To add Surface Hub resolutions to the simulator:
segment.target: To add Surface Hub resolutions to the simulator:

segment.source: Create a configuration for the 55" Surface Hub by saving the following XML into a file named HardwareConfigurations-SurfaceHub55.xml.
segment.target: Create a configuration for the 55" Surface Hub by saving the following XML into a file named HardwareConfigurations-SurfaceHub55.xml.

segment.source: Create a configuration for the 84" Surface Hub by saving the following XML into a file named HardwareConfigurations-SurfaceHub84.xml.
segment.target: Create a configuration for the 84" Surface Hub by saving the following XML into a file named HardwareConfigurations-SurfaceHub84.xml.

segment.source: Copy the two XML files into C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files\Microsoft Shared\Windows Simulatorversion number\HardwareConfigurations.
segment.target: Copy the two XML files into C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files\Microsoft Shared\Windows Simulatorversion number\HardwareConfigurations.

segment.source: Note Administrative privileges are required to save files into this folder.
segment.target: Note Administrative privileges are required to save files into this folder.

segment.source: Run your app in the Visual Studio simulator.
segment.target: Run your app in the Visual Studio simulator.

segment.source: Click the Change Resolution button on the palette and select a Surface Hub configuration from the list.
segment.target: Click the Change Resolution button on the palette and select a Surface Hub configuration from the list.

segment.source: Visual Studio simulator resolutions
segment.target: Visual Studio simulator resolutions

segment.source:
Tip
Turn on Tablet mode to better simulate the experience on a Surface Hub.
segment.target:
Tip
Turn on Tablet mode to better simulate the experience on a Surface Hub.

segment.source: Deploy apps to a Surface Hub from Visual Studio
segment.target: Deploy apps to a Surface Hub from Visual Studio

segment.source: Manually deploying an app is a simple process.
segment.target: Manually deploying an app is a simple process.

segment.source: Enable developer mode
segment.target: Enable developer mode

segment.source: By default, Surface Hub only installs apps from the Windows Store.
segment.target: By default, Surface Hub only installs apps from the Windows Store.

segment.source: To install apps signed by other sources, you must enable developer mode.
segment.target: To install apps signed by other sources, you must enable developer mode.

segment.source: Note After developer mode has been enabled, you will need to reset the Surface Hub to disable it again.
segment.target: Note After developer mode has been enabled, you will need to reset the Surface Hub to disable it again.

segment.source: Resetting the device removes all local user files and configurations and then reinstalls Windows.
segment.target: Resetting the device removes all local user files and configurations and then reinstalls Windows.

segment.source: From the Surface Hub's Start menu, open the Settings app.
segment.target: From the Surface Hub's Start menu, open the Settings app.

segment.source: Note Administrative privileges are required to access the Settings app.
segment.target: Note Administrative privileges are required to access the Settings app.

segment.source: Navigate to Update & security > For developers.
segment.target: Navigate to Update & security > For developers.

segment.source: Choose Developer mode and accept the warning prompt.
segment.target: Choose Developer mode and accept the warning prompt.

segment.source: Deploy your app from Visual Studio
segment.target: Deploy your app from Visual Studio

segment.source: For more information, see Deploying and debugging Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.
segment.target: For more information, see Deploying and debugging Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps.

segment.source: Note This feature requires at least Visual Studio 2015 Update 1.
segment.target: Note This feature requires at least Visual Studio 2015 Update 1.

segment.source: Navigate to the debug target dropdown next to the Start Debugging button and select Remote Machine.
segment.target: Navigate to the debug target dropdown next to the Start Debugging button and select Remote Machine.

segment.source: Visual Studio debug targets dropdown
segment.target: Visual Studio debug targets dropdown

segment.source: Enter the Surface Hub's IP address.
segment.target: Enter the Surface Hub's IP address.

segment.source: Ensure that the Universal authentication mode is selected.
segment.target: Ensure that the Universal authentication mode is selected.

segment.source: Tip After you have enabled developer mode, you can find the Surface Hub's IP address on the welcome screen.
segment.target: Tip After you have enabled developer mode, you can find the Surface Hub's IP address on the welcome screen.

segment.source: Choose Start Debugging (F5) to deploy and debug your app on the Surface Hub, or press Ctrl+F5 to just deploy your app.
segment.target: Choose Start Debugging (F5) to deploy and debug your app on the Surface Hub, or press Ctrl+F5 to just deploy your app.

segment.source: Tip If the Surface Hub is on the welcome screen, dismiss it by choosing any button.
segment.target: Tip If the Surface Hub is on the welcome screen, dismiss it by choosing any button.
